newsitem.title: USA: Iochpe-Maxion unit to buy some Dana assets.
newsitem.headline: Iochpe-Maxion unit to buy some Dana assets.

text.p: Iochpe-Maxion Ohio said Wednesday it will buy some strategic assets from Dana Corp's Heavy Truck Structural Components division.
In exchange, Dana gets a minority investment in Iochpe-Maxion's Midland Steel Products division, the company said.
The company said its Midland unit will provide heat-treated frame rails to Dana to use in modular system assemblies, and Dana will give Midland technical assistance.
Midland Steel operates two plants with about 400 employees in Cleveland, Ohio, and Janesville, Wisconsin. The business supplies structural components for medium and heavy trucks.

Parent company Iochpe-Maxion SA of Sao Paulo, Brazil, makes and distributes products for the passenger car and truck industries. It has eight plants in North and South America with about 5,000 employees. Its 1995 sales were $763.8 million, the company said.
